Detailed Description

This class manages and draws lens effects.

During the rendering pass, an object can register a lens effect with the LensEffectManager. If that lens effect is already alive, it will be refreshed. If this is a new lens effect, then it will fade in.

During LensEffectManager::tick, it will decay the age of current lens effects, and cull any lens effects that no longer exist.

During LensEffectManager::draw, it will perform line-of-sight checks on the scene, and ask individual lens effects to draw.

The lens effect manager uses plug-in photon occluder classes to perform line-of-sight checks.

Member Function Documentation

void LensEffectManager::add ( uint32  id,
const Vector3 &  worldPosition,
const LensEffect &  le 
)

This method adds a lens effect for a single frame to the manager.

If the lens effect is already in existence( if the id matches one already in the list ), then it is simply refreshed.

For simple flares, it will use 2nd implementation designed for large numbers of simple flares.

Parameters:
id a unique id for the lens flare. This can be anything that is persistent between frames.
worldPosition the world position of the lens effect
le contains the details about the lens effect to add.

void LensEffectManager::addPhotonOccluder ( PhotonOccluder *  occluder  ) 

This method adds a photon occluder to the lens effects visibility determination.

void LensEffectManager::clear ( void   ) 

This method kills all lens effects from the list, with exception of the sun.

void LensEffectManager::delPhotonOccluder ( PhotonOccluder *  occluder  ) 

Method to remove a photon occluder.

bool LensEffectManager::doFini (  )  [virtual]

this method releases all of the materials.

it should be called before the cleanup of static objects ( like the lens effect manager singleton ) because there is an order dependency on ManagedEffects.

Reimplemented from InitSingleton< LensEffectManager >.

bool LensEffectManager::doInit (  )  [virtual]

Reimplemented from InitSingleton< LensEffectManager >.

void LensEffectManager::draw (  )  [virtual]

This method draws all current lens effects.

void LensEffectManager::forget ( uint32  id  ) 

This method causes the lens effect manager to forget about the given lens effect id.

It will accept no more updates for the existing lens effect with that id. This is only necessary if you want to reuse the id for a different lens effect.

Moo::EffectMaterialPtr LensEffectManager::getMaterial ( const std::string &  material  ) 

This method sets the appropriate material for the given lens effect.

Parameters:
material Name of the material to retrieve.
Returns:
A pointer to the Moo::EffectMaterial on success, NULL on error.

void LensEffectManager::killFlares ( const std::set< uint32 > &  ids  ) 

This method culls lens effects from the list corresponding to the supplied id list.

Parameters:
ids the id's of the lens effects to cull from the list.

Parameters:
